• Icons

    The graphic images below are SVG, an image format for vector graphics. These images are not physical images that you link to like a typical .gif, .jpg or .png. Vvector-based icons look great in a high pixel density world and offers design control, and predictability. The examples below are the base examples with minimal customizing. They also have a nested span and label which is used for accessibility.

    Logos

    1. Header Logo

    3. Header Logo (no text)

    5. Print Header Logo

    7. Logo White Background

    • Icon placed before text
    • Icon placed after text

    Horizontal icon spacing must be manually added with a space.

    Icon With No Description Example

    Best practices suggests to add an icon description within the icon HTML like the PDF in <span>PDF</span>. However, there may be a situation where that description is not displayed to the average user. This can be achieved by adding icon-only to the opening icon HTML element. For example: <span class="ico icon-only pdf">.

    PDF
    <!-- PDF -->
<span class="ico icon-only pdf">
    <span>PDF</span>
</span>
    XLS
    <!-- XLS -->
<span class="ico icon-only xls">
    <span>XLS</span>
</span>
    CSV
    <!-- CSV -->
<span class="ico icon-only csv">
    <span>CSV</span>
</span>
    Interactive
    <!-- interactive -->
<span class="ico icon-only interactive">
    <span>Interactive</span>
</span>
    PPT
    <!-- PPT -->

    <span>PPT</span>
</span>

    <span>HTML</span>
</span>

  • External Link

    Using CSS rules in the base.less file. The rules will add an external link icon to all links that have a https://, https://, and .com in the URL except if eia.gov is in the file name. Additionally, special rules remove the external link from the .social (vertical slider) and .bx-<iewport(sliders).</a> To force an external link you can simply add a class="external-link" to the anchor tag.

    External Link
    <!-- external-link -->
<span class="external-link">
    <span>External Link</span>
</span>
